headline: Western Digital (WDC) Valuation Check After Sharp 90 Day Share Price Rally
summary: Western Digital (WDC) has drawn attention after recent share price moves, prompting investors to reassess how its current valuation lines up with the business behind its hard drives, data center platforms, and consumer storage products. See our latest analysis for Western Digital. The recent run up in Western Digital’s share price, including a 55.04% 90 day share price return and a very large 3 year total shareholder return, points to momentum that has shifted firmly in buyers’ favor as...

headline: Sandisk Stock Soars 22%. The Reason Why Is Unclear.
summary: Shares of  Sandisk  soared 22% to $334.75 without an obvious catalyst on Tuesday as investors continued to pour money into the flash memory company.  Sandisk  began trading at $36 a share last February after spinning off from  Western Digital  The stock has since joined the  and surged more than 800% since the spinoff, with artificial intelligence boosting demand for solid state drives and other data-storage hardware.  Tuesday was Sandisk’s largest single-day jump since Feb. 18, 2025, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: Why Western Digital (WDC) Is Up 6.7% After AI Cloud Demand Strains High-Capacity HDD Supply – And What's Next
summary: In early January 2026, Western Digital highlighted surging AI and cloud data center demand for its high-capacity hard disk drives amid tight supply for enterprise and hyperscale storage. The company’s sharpened focus on HDDs after separating its flash business, combined with NASDAQ-100 inclusion and upbeat analyst commentary, has underscored its role as an important infrastructure supplier for AI-era data storage. We’ll now examine how Western Digital’s AI-driven cloud storage momentum,...

headline: Sandisk’s 1,000% Rally Is Turbocharged by Nvidia CEO’s Remarks
summary: It’s the best performer in the S&P 500 Index Tuesday, followed by memory and storage companies Western Digital Corp. and Seagate Technology Holdings Plc, both of which are posting double-digit percentage gains.  “For storage, that is a completely unserved market today,” Huang said at CES Monday.  “This is a market that never existed, and this market will likely be the largest storage market in the world, basically holding the working memory of the world’s AIs.”

headline: Sandisk stock soars after Nvidia CEO calls memory storage "unserved market"
summary: Investing.com -- Sandisk stock surged 27% Tuesday after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang described the memory storage chip market as an "unserved market" with massive growth potential. Other memory and storage stocks also rallied, with Western Digital jumping 17%, Seagate Technology rising 14%, and Micron gaining 9%.

content.title: Sandisk stock soars after Nvidia CEO calls memory storage "unserved market"
content.summary: Investing.com -- Sandisk stock surged 27% Tuesday after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang described the memory storage chip market as an "unserved market" with massive growth potential. Other memory and storage stocks also rallied, with Western Digital jumping 17%, Seagate Technology rising 14%, and Micron gaining 9%.

headline: Dow Finally Closes Above 49,000. S&P 500 Also Hits Record.
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average finally finished north of 49,000 Tuesday, and the S&P 500 hit a milestone of its own. The Dow gained 485 points, or 1%. The S&P 500 rose 0.6%. Both finished the day with closing highs.

content.title: Dow Finally Closes Above 49,000. S&P 500 Also Hits Record.
content.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average finally finished north of 49,000 Tuesday, and the S&P 500 hit a milestone of its own. The Dow gained 485 points, or 1%. The S&P 500 rose 0.6%. Both finished the day with closing highs.

headline: Microchip Technology, NXP Semiconductors, Texas Instruments, Western Digital, and Allegro MicroSystems Stocks Trade Up, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks jumped in the afternoon session after a broader market rally drove investor optimism in artificial intelligence and big tech stocks. The S&P 500, Dow Jones, and Nasdaq all pushed higher, approaching record levels set late last year. Much of the positive momentum was linked to the technology sector, with a particular focus on companies advancing artificial intelligence, a key theme at the annual CES trade show in Las Vegas. headline: Memory Stocks Surge as Shortage Is Expected to Worsen
summary: Sandisk, a maker of NAND flash memory, surged 25% while hard-drive makers Seagate and Western Digital jumped 14% and 17% respectively.  Micron, which produces primarily DRAM memory chips, was up 8.7%.  In a report Monday, market research firm Trendforce projected that contact prices for NAND flash memory will jump 30%-35% just in the first quarter of this year.

content.title: Memory Stocks Surge as Shortage Is Expected to Worsen
content.summary: Sandisk, a maker of NAND flash memory, surged 25% while hard-drive makers Seagate and Western Digital jumped 14% and 17% respectively.  Micron, which produces primarily DRAM memory chips, was up 8.7%.  In a report Monday, market research firm Trendforce projected that contact prices for NAND flash memory will jump 30%-35% just in the first quarter of this year.

headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Sandisk Flies Higher
summary: Computer data-storage stocks surged, after comments by Nvidia late Monday at the CES trade show.  Sandisk soared 28% and is up almost 900% since the company’s spinoff from Western Digital last February.  At the conference, Nvidia Chief Executive Jensen Huang discussed a new memory-storage platform for the company’s newest artificial-intelligence servers, known as Vera Rubin, expected to go on sale in the second half of this year.

content.title: Heard on the Street Recap: Sandisk Flies Higher
content.summary: Computer data-storage stocks surged, after comments by Nvidia late Monday at the CES trade show.  Sandisk soared 28% and is up almost 900% since the company’s spinoff from Western Digital last February.  At the conference, Nvidia Chief Executive Jensen Huang discussed a new memory-storage platform for the company’s newest artificial-intelligence servers, known as Vera Rubin, expected to go on sale in the second half of this year.

headline: Sandisk Stock Soars 27%. The Focus Is on AI, Earnings From Memory Suppliers.
summary: Shares of  Sandisk  soared more than 27% to $349.63 on Tuesday to a new record as investors continued to pour money into the flash memory company.  Sandisk  began trading at $36 a share last February after spinning off from  Western Digital  The stock has since joined the  and surged more than 800% from the spinoff, with artificial intelligence boosting demand and prices for solid state drives, or SSDs.  Tuesday was Sandisk’s largest single-day jump since Feb. 18, according to Dow Jones Market Data.
